result.execSummary:
The defendant Mackenzie W Donath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Concurrent with: 14-CM-1024.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond on file shall be applied to amounts due. Remaining balance to be applied to costs due in 14-CM-1024.

Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with Lydia S.
Defendant shall not have violent contact with Debra D.

Defendant shall take medications as prescribed.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Disposition Form
Def in person & by Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. State confirms victim rights compliance. Statements by counsel. Defendant sentenced.
Sentencing hearing reset per request of Atty Weil and no objection by DA from May 21, 2015 at 8:15 am to May 27, 2015 at 1:15 pm. Atty Weil to confirm in writing.
Amended Victims' Rights Information; Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Sentencing hearing at 05-21-2015 08:15 am

Def in person & by Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. Agreement reached for def to enter pleas and adjourn sentencing. State indicates victim impact statement needs to be obtained before proceeding to sentencing. Def pleads guilty to count #5 and #6; def is convicted. Counts #1 through #4 are dismissed and read in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Authorization for Defense Counsel to Appear

Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Plea hearing on May 6, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Matthew E. Weil.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (14CM1024 Br. 2 and 14CM1340 Br. 4)  Court advises on Amended Criminal Complaint and finds probable cause as to Count 4 minor changes and added Count 6.  Counsel advises competency evaluation conducted in another case and request adjournment for pretrial and likely will be a global resolution.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on March 26, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Atty Matthew E. Weil appearing for Def.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (14CM1024 Br. 2, 14CM1340 Br. 4)  Court needs to advise on Amended Criminal Complaint.  Counsel advises defendant was confused about today's hearing due to cases pending in three different branches.  Counsel requested a competency eval in another case and request adjournment until after return of competency eval.  Court orders defendant to appear for next court date.  Hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety; Take medications as prescribed; No contact with LS in person, text messages, a third party, her residence, or by social media form
Hearing on February 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (14CM1024 Br.2; 14CM1340 Br.4)  State moves to amend Count 4 to reflect 2015, Court grants amendment. State moves to amend Count 4 under 947.012(1)(b) and will file amended complaint, Court grants amendment. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Atty. Matthew Weil will be assigned to this case as is assigned to other pending cases.  State request $1,000.00 cash bond, counsel makes statements regarding defendant's medications and medical issues.  Court orders $500.00 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
